definitions.definition: A glimmering glass-like mineral that is an allotrope of carbon in which each atom is surrounded by four others in the form of a tetrahedron.
definitions.example: The saw is coated with diamond.

definitions.definition: A gemstone made from this mineral.
definitions.example: The dozen loose diamonds sparkled in the light.

definitions.definition: A rhombus, especially when oriented so that its longer axis is vertical.
The polyiamond made up of two triangles.
The entire field of play used in the game.
The infield of a baseball field.
definitions.example: The teams met on the diamond.

definitions.definition: A card of the diamonds suit.
definitions.example: I have only one diamond in my hand.

definitions.definition: A size of type, standardised as 4 1/2 point.
To adorn with or as if with diamonds
Made of, or containing diamond, a diamond or diamonds.
Of, relating to, or being a sixtieth anniversary.
definitions.example: Today is their diamond wedding anniversary.

definitions.definition: Of, relating to, or being a seventy-fifth anniversary.

definitions.definition: The size of type between brilliant and pearl, standardized as 4 1/2-point.
